roleset.name: take, acquire, come to have, choose, bring with you from somewhere, internalize, ingest
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: Roleset maps to VN classes bring-11.3, steal-10.5: classes involving movement, acceptance of another entity. (from take.01-v)
TAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, take.01. Corresponds to VNcls bring-11.3, steal-10.5, hire-13.5.3. (from taking.01-n)

roles.note: WATCH OUT FOR LIGHT VERBISH NOMINALS-- these have their own roleset, take.28.Arg3 added for destination since the lack of that arg has been so problematic with the verb frame. (from taking.01-n)

role.descr: taken FROM, SOURCE of thing taken

example.name: take-v: take office
example.text: President Carlos Menem took office July 8.

example.name: take-v: take the law
example.text: She took the law into her own hands

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: The whole trip takes about half the day .

example.name: take-v: capture, take militarily
example.text: [The Federal forces]-1 had taken Parkersburg and Grafton from the Rebels and were moving *-1 to take all the mountains .

example.name: take-v: args 0, 1
example.text: 2014, the 30-year anniversary of his taking the job

example.name: take-v: args 0, 1
example.text: Another way to look at this problem is to consider how much medicine is in the patient's system just prior to his taking the pill.

roleset.name: tolerate
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: No Vncls. (from take.02-v)
TAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.02. No VNcls. (from taking.02-n)

example.name: take-v: tough movement
example.text: [That]-1 got hard *PRO* to take *trace*-1.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Over three years , the fund has gone from taking losses to taking off ; though it has levelled off somewhat lately , the returns have been excellent .

example.name: taking-n: both args
example.text: Is Sanborn suggesting his taking abuse might prove him a ?real man,? real enough to put on the bomb suit?

roleset.name: cause (to be)
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls convert-26.6.2 (from take.03-v)
TAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.03. Corresponds to VNcls convert-26.6.2 (from taking.03-n)

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Now over 20,000 franchises worldwide work to expand the company 's territory while the headquarters takes 0.5 % of operating revenues as its share for as long as the franchise lasts .
example.arg: for as long as the franchise lasts

roleset.name: understand to be
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: Member of VNcls characterize-29.2. (from take.04-v)
TAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.04. Corresponds to VNcls characterize-29.2. (from taking.04-n)

example.name: take-v: bummer
example.text: They took the announcement as bad news.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Take , for instance , this litter of Fengshui Kitties , lined up here with each holding a different colored pearl : red , purple , blue , white or yellow .
example.arg: this litter of Fengshui Kitties , lined up here with each holding a different colored pearl : red , purple , blue , white or yellow

example.name: take-v: i.e. principles understand cheating is serious.
example.text: Principals take cheating seriously.

example.name: taking-n: all args
example.text: Searle's submission to the work is indicated by his taking the painting,as it were,at its word: visual evidence is privileged positivistically.

roleset.name: fixed phrase: take place
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: No Vncls. (from take.14-v)
TAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.14. No VNcls. (from taking.14-n)

example.name: take-v: take place
example.text: These events took place 35 years ago.

example.name: taking-n: both args
example.text: That is, where a do compound affirms the event's taking place, a modal compound affirms the conditions of potentiality governing the event's taking place.

roleset.name: write-off, acknowledge a (financial) loss
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: No Vncls. (from take.15-v)
TAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.15. No VNcls. (from taking.15-n)

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: The company took a $ 20 million charge in the fiscal first quarter ended April 29 , related to discontinuing the service .
example.arg: [related to discontinuing the service][a $ 20 million charge]
in the fiscal first quarter ended April 29

example.name: taking-n: all args
example.text: In anticipation of his taking a loss on the sale of his house, he also negotiated the addition of a signing bonus of $20k (despite being unemployed).
example.arg: on the sale of his house

roleset.name: need, requiring
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: Maps to VN classes fit-54.3, cost-54.2& require-103. (from take.10-v)
TAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.10. Corresponds to VNcls fit-54.3, cost-54.2, require-103. (from taking.10-n)

example.name: take-v: active
example.text: Being so fragile and minute, they will take special special robotic handling equipment.

example.name: take-v: it-support
example.text: It [*EXP*-1] took me a half-hour [*]to move 10 feet from my parking spot in an outer lot to an aisle, and an additional hour to reach an inner roadway a half-block away.
example.arg: [*] to move 10 feet from my parking spot in an outer lot to an aisle

example.name: take-v: typical out-of-order
example.text: Graduate students are taking longer than ever [*-1] to get their doctor of philosophy degrees, the National Research Council says.
example.arg: [*-1] to get their doctor of philosophy degrees

example.name: ARG0 and ARG2 and ARG1
example.text: In America telephones reached 90 % of households in 50 years , whereas it only took video recorders 18 years to do the same .

roleset.name: take by surprise, taking by surprise (or some other manner)
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: No Vncls. (from take.16-v)
TAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.16. No VNcls. (from taking.16-n)

example.name: take-v: surprise!
example.text: Rumors of an impending devaluation have been circulating in Moscow for weeks , but the size of the cut took many Western bankers by surprise .

example.name: taking-n: all args
example.text: Josephus has five episodes of conflict with the Tiberians in the Life, none of which involves his taking the city by storm.

roleset.name: become fond of
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: Keep in mind that usages such as "take care," "take into consideration," "take steps," where the head of the object are also predicating elements, are Light Verb usages, and should be marked .LV. (from take.17-v predicate notes)
TAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.17. No VNcls. (from taking.17-n)

example.name: take-v: ballooning? really?
example.text: Americans it seems [0] [*T*-1]have followed Malcolm Forbes 's hot-air lead and taken to ballooning in a heady way .

example.name: taking-n: both args
example.text: ...and had he not been a man of inflexible morals and regular habits, there would have been a great danger of his taking to politics, or drinking,?both which pernicious vices we daily see men driven to by mere spleen and idleness.
example.arg: to politics, or drinking, -- both which pernicious vices we daily see men driven to by mere spleen and idleness

roleset.name: swindle/rob someone of something
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: No VNcls. Added by Julia based on Callhome-1. (from take.25-v)
TAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.25. No VNcls. (from taking.25-n)

example.name: take-v: the syntax should look like this
example.text: In the divorce, she took him for half of everything.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: she probably took him for half of it now

roleset.name: light verb
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: Keep in mind that usages such as "take care,""take into consideration," "take steps," where the head of the object are also predicating elements, are Light Verb usages, and should bemarked .LV. (from take.LV-v predicate notes)

example.name: take.LV: take lesson
example.text: Sony took a lesson from the American management books.

example.name: take.LV: take measures
example.text: It has taken measures to prevent cheating.

example.name: take.LV: take advantage
example.text: According to industry lawyers, the ruling gives [pipeline companies]-1 an important second chance *trace*-1 to resolve remaining disputes and take advantage of the cost-sharing mechanism.

example.name: take.LV: take some comfort
example.text: Investors unsetled by the stock market's recent gyrations can take some comfort in the predictable arrival of quarterly dividend checks.

roleset.name: take after; heredity, similarity
roleset.note: TAKE-V NOTES: Added by Julia for BOLT

example.name: name-v
example.text: She will take after you when she grows up

roleset.name: opinion, perspective, position
roleset.note: TAKE-N NOTES: Added by Julia

example.name: take-n
example.text: My take on this is that "we too" probably sounds overly formal to most listeners.
example.arg: is that "we too" probably sounds overly formal to most listeners

roleset.name: take away: remove
roleset.note: TAKE_AWAY-V NOTES: (from take.05-v)
TAKING_AWAY-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.05. No VNcls. (from taking.05-n)

example.name: take_away-v: Calgon, take me away!
example.text: [Marshall Coleman]-1 wants to *trace*-1 take away your right to choose

example.name: taking_away-n: all args
example.text: Having already killed his wife and sons out of fear of their taking away his power, he has no remorse in ordering all newborn males in Bethlehem killed

roleset.name: take in: give shelter
roleset.note: TAKE_IN-V NOTES: might be misparsed (from take.06-v predicate notes)
TAKING_IN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.06. No VNcls. (from taking.06-n)

example.name: take_in-v: Arg0 rel Arg1
example.text: This exclusive club has taken in a host of flashy new members
example.arg: a host of flashy new members

example.name: taking_in-n: both args
example.text: You can debate the wisdom of his taking in strays all you want, he won't change that.

roleset.name: enjoy, experience, especially viewing, taking_in: enjoying sensory input (esp viewing)
roleset.note: TAKE_IN-V NOTES: Roleset based on webtext instances. No relevant VN entry. Comparison to watch. Framed by Claire. (from take.23-v)
TAKING_IN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.23. No VNcls. (from taking.23-n)

example.name: take_in-v: Args 0 & 1
example.text: However , I took in NTD TV 's Chinese New Year Spectacular as a friend had suggested and my literary and art cells sprung immediately and unexpectedly back to life .
example.arg: NTD TV's Chinese New Year Spectacular

example.name: take_in-v: Very Similar
example.text: It's a city where-1 you can settle for a Broadway musical, enjoy a classic Shakespeare production, or take in a puppet show on a any given day *T*-1.

example.name: taking_in-n: both args
example.text: Additionally, there are several San Francisco Hotels close to the vicinity of Fisherman?s Wharf where tourists can stay after their taking in the sights.

roleset.name: take off: remove
roleset.note: TAKE_OFF-V NOTES: (from take.07-v)
TAKING_OFF-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.07. No VNcls. (from taking.07-n)

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: The painters took turns taking off their shirts to model for each other , and Hsia would sometimes spend the whole day sketching customers at the ice - cream shop by the train station , after paying for a single slice of watermelon .

example.name: taking_off-n: both args
example.text: On one day in August, Day fired off 11 messages, known as tweets, covering such issues as a gate agent's cranky behavior, Southwest job openings and a passenger's in-flight meltdown that led to his taking off his clothes.

roleset.name: take off: increase dramatically
roleset.note: TAKE_OFF-V NOTES: (from take.08-v)
TAKING_OFF-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.08. No VNcls, but see calibratable_cos-45.6. (from taking.08-n)

roles.note: Arg2 added due to expected usage. Ideally, the verb frame should have this as well. (from taking.08-n)

role.descr: specific aspect of arg1 that is taking off

example.name: take_off-v: zoom
example.text: The pace has taken off.

example.name: taking_off-n: both args
example.text: Gold's taking off in price came as a shock to the prospector

roleset.name: process of becoming airborne, as a plane
roleset.note: TAKE_OFF-V NOTES: (from take.19-v)
TAKING_OFF-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.19. No VNcls. (from taking.19-n)

example.name: take_off-v: leavin' on a jet plane...
example.text: Keep in mind that this is the same movie in which a character is flattened by a steamroller only to pop right back up and peer in the window of a Boeing 747 -- from the outside -- as it takes off.

example.name: taking_off-n: both args
example.text: This video is of their taking off from Grimes Field starting at 7:00 am with one plane taking off every 90 seconds.
example.arg: with one plane taking off every 90 seconds

roleset.name: take time off, like for vacation
roleset.note: TAKE_OFF-V NOTES: (from take.18-v)
TAKING_OFF-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.18. No VNcls. (from taking.18-n)

example.name: take_off-v: mental health day
example.text: And when Mr. Engelken asked him why he took time [*ICH*-1] [*ICH*-2]off from work for somebody he didn't even know [*T*-4] [*T*-5] [*T*-6]...
example.arg: for someone he didn't even know

example.name: taking_off-n: all args
example.text: Daniel and I were discussing his taking a week off from work to drive me up there.

roleset.name: get going, hit the road
roleset.note: TAKE_OFF-V TAKING_OFF-N NOTES: Added by Julia for AMR.

example.name: take_off-v
example.text: ever since i was old enough to figure out how to use public transportation by myself, i've been taking off on whim to wherever.
example.arg: ever since i was old enough to figure out how to use public transportation by myself

roleset.name: take on: acquire, hiring, undertaking
roleset.note: TAKE_ON-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia, 10/2010. Member of Vncls adopt-93. (from take.09-v)
TAKING_ON-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.09. Corresponds to VNcls adopt-93. (from taking.09-n)

roles.note: refer to acquire and other verbs-of-acquisition for usage ofhigher-numbered args (from take.09-v)

example.name: take_on-v: simple transitive
example.text: A young, short-term employee can't take on any responsibility

example.name: taking_on-n: arg1 as an undertaking
example.text: In exchange for their taking on that work, the rest of us need to trust that our colleagues are working diligently on our behalf.

example.name: taking_on-n: arg1 animate
example.text: Despite the concern of their lawyers and accountants about their taking on new partners, they developed a plan to open a dozen food businesses under the same brand utilizing committed, passionate business partners that upheld the same ideals of community involvement.

example.name: taking_on-n: args 0, 1
example.text: There may not have been any choice in their taking on these duties.

roleset.name: take on: (prepare for) battle, taking_on: facing in battle
roleset.note: TAKE_ON-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia, 10/2010. Member of Vncls confront-98. (from take.21-v)
TAKING_ON-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.21. Corresponds to VNcls confront-98. (from taking.21-n)

example.name: take_on-v: David and Goliath
example.text: ``I will sit down and talk some of the problems out, but take on the political system? Uh-uh,'' he says with a shake of the head.

example.name: taking_on-n: both args
example.text: Much of Hollywood was sceptical at their taking on such a Goliath, but they won and Simmons was able to star at MGM in Young Bess (1953) with Granger, Charles Laughton and Deborah Kerr supporting the radiant star.

roleset.name: take out: obtain, draw (out)
roleset.note: TAKE_OUT-V NOTES: (from take.11-v)
TAKING_OUT-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.11. No VNcls. (from taking.11-n)

example.name: take_out-v: take out an ad
example.text: A company once took out an ad.

example.name: taking_out-n: both args
example.text: In this decision, we hold that Colonel Wexler's employing agency must reimburse him for expenses he incurred in taking out that loan, since the expenses are similar in kind and amount to those for which reimbursement is specifically made appropriate by the Federal Travel Regulation (FTR).

roleset.name: project anger on someone, idiomatic, taking_out: directing neg emotion towards someone (unfairly)
roleset.note: TAKE_OUT-V NOTES: Roleset added due to instances in CallHome corpus. Framed by Claire. No VN class. (from take.26-v)
TAKING_OUT-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.26. No VNcls. (from taking.26-n)

example.name: take_out-v: Typical Usage
example.text: Whether they take it out on Governor Schwartzeneggar in California could be another test of that as well.

example.name: taking_out-n: all args
example.text: I hope you can figure out a way to provide your children with whatever your mom wasn?t able to provide you, and help your DH overcome his taking out his rage on the kids.

roleset.name: kill, taking_out: killing
roleset.note: TAKE_OUT-V NOTES: Based on "take out" instances in BOLT part 1. Framed by Claire. (from take.27-v)
TAKING_OUT-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.27. No VNcls. (from taking.27-n)

role.descr: killer, person taking out someone or something

example.name: take_out-v: Both args, typical usage
example.text: Remember when we-1 went in PRO-1 to take out Bin Laden we could n't tell the Pakistani government for fear that Bin Laden would have been tipped off and escaped ...

example.name: taking_out-n: both args
example.text: Obama will be remembered for his taking out Bin Laden, Awlaki, decimating and crushing Al-Qaida.

roleset.name: take_out: vacation
roleset.note: TAKE_OUT-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, take_off.18. (from take.28-v)

role.descr: work, job, etc (taking a vacation from)

example.name: take_out-v: args 0, 1
example.text: I do n't know whether *PRO*-1 to just go , or take a year out , and try and ask my medical school for a deferred entry -LRB- which is unlikely I think -RRB- .

example.name: take_out-v: All args + PRP
example.text: [Fearne Cotton]-1 is set *PRO*-1 to take a year out from her television career to concentrate on motherhood - and we'll genuinely miss her!

roleset.name: take over: become dominant, in charge
roleset.note: TAKE_OVER-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia, 10/2010. Member of Vncls adopt-93. (from take.12-v)
TAKING_OVER-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.12. Corresponds to VNcls adopt-93. (from taking.12-n)
TAKEOVER-N NOTES: Roleset based on take.12. No corresponding VN class. Framed by Katie (from takeover.01-n)

roles.note: Arg2 added due to expected occurance (from taking.12-n)

example.name: take_over-v: unstated object
example.text: Mrs. Ward took over in 1986

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Now people have started wondering if overseas Chinese from Southeast Asia - and in particular from Singapore and Malaysia - are taking over the mainstream of the Taiwanese music industry .
example.arg: overseas Chinese from Southeast Asia - and in particular from Singapore and Malaysia
the mainstream of the Taiwanese music industry

example.name: taking_over-n: args 0, 2
example.text: Vanderbilt interim head coach Robbie Caldwell talks about his taking over for Bobby Johnson.

example.name: taking_over-n: Strange steed...
example.text: The Anniversary Of His Taking Over The Reins Of The World's Fifth-biggest G
example.arg: the reins of the world's fifth-biggest G

example.name: takeover-n: example with both args
example.text: its takeover by Coniston Partners

example.name: takeover-n: Example with only arg 1
example.text: the UAL takeover

example.name: takeover-n: Example with both args where arg 0 may be confusing
example.text: An opposition takeover of the company

example.name: takeover-n: Make sure you know whether an arg is the thing taking over or the thing begin taken over
example.text: The WWP takeover

example.name: takeover-n: Arg 1 as a pp
example.text: The takeover of Britain's Plessey Co.

roleset.name: occupy space
roleset.note: TAKE_UP-V NOTES: No Vncls . (from take.13-v)
TAKING_UP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on one aspect of take.13. No VNcls. (from taking.13-n)

roles.note: arg2 is a different arg2 from the verb frame, which was trying to accommodate separate senses that take separate syntax. This arg2 is more like the theme arg seen in the spatial configuration VNcls (although this frame does not correspond to that VNcls fully). (from taking.13-n)

role.descr: specific thing arg0 is using to take up space (if separate)

example.name: take_up-v: vaguely passive
example.text: Most of the picture is taken up with endless scenes of talking heads.
example.arg: with endless scenes of talking heads

example.name: taking_up-n: all args
example.text: I've come far since then (1 year August since my RAI)& generally feel well, so I hope you don't mind my taking up space with post-trauma thyroid issues.

roleset.name: raise an issue/grievance
roleset.note: TAKE_UP-V NOTES: This was formerly included in take-v.13, but that frame has been split.
TAKING_UP-N NOTES: Added by Julia for unification

example.name: take_up-v: active
example.text: The Senate will take up the measure quickly.

example.name: take_up-v: with arg2
example.text: They took it up with Warner.

roleset.name: start a habitual activity
roleset.note: TAKE_UP-V NOTES: This was formerly included in take-v.13, but that frame has been split.
TAKING_UP-N NOTES: Added by Julia for unification

role.descr: entity taking up a new activity

example.name: take_up-v
example.text: He took up knitting

roleset.name: take aback: different kind of surprise, taking_aback: surprising, offensively
roleset.note: TAKE_ABACK-V NOTES: (from take.20-v)
TAKING_ABACK-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.20. No VNcls. (from taking.20-n)

roles.note: This one is probably quite rare and somewhat awkward, and will necessarily have an extra arg compared to the current verb frame to even work. (from taking.20-n)

example.name: take_aback-v: only passive
example.text: [He]-4 is taken [*-4]aback in an interview when asked whether, as mayor, he plans on reforming the political ``fiefdoms'' that perpetuate the monumental ineffectiveness of New York's school system.
example.arg: when asked whether, as mayor, he plans on reforming the political ``fiefdoms'' that perpetuate the monumental ineffectiveness of New York's school system

example.name: taking_aback-n: both args
example.text: I was so out of control by his taking me aback that I didn't know what to do ? to laugh from hysteria,

roleset.name: deconstruct, destroy, bringin an end to, defeat
roleset.note: TAKE_DOWN-V NOTES: predicate added by Arrick (from take.22-v)

TAKING_DOWN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based loosely on take.22 (although here we should try to use "DIR" with down using take.01 when possible, and use this frame for the more finite 'defeat', 'end' sense). No VNcls. (from taking.22-n)

example.name: take_down-v
example.text: and that is *PRO* to take down their nuclear program dismantle it dismantle their weapons of mass destruction programs in a verifiable way before all those assurances can go into place.

example.name: taking_down-n: both args
example.text: As he stood on the rooftop studying the darkened windows of the strip joint across from him, Dick noticed that sometime between his taking down the dark stranger and reaching the corner of Water Street and Shoreline Drive, the drenching rain had stopped.

roleset.name: grab, taking_hold: grabbing, physically or abstractly
roleset.note: TAKE_HOLD-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on instance in Brown. No Vncls. (from take.24-v)
TAKING_HOLD-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on take.24. No VNcls. (from taking.24-n)

example.name: take_hold-v: Brown example
example.text: And then the Amen corner took hold , re-enacting a form of group participation in worship that stemmed from years before the Greek chorus , spreading down through the African forest , overseas to the West Indies , and then here in Alabama .
example.arg: re-enacting a form of group participation in worship that stemmed from years before the Greek chorus, preading down through the African forest, overseas to the West Indies, and then here in Alabama

example.name: take_hold-v: Russian folk tale with lots of grabbing.
example.text: The mouse took hold of the cat, the cat took hold of the dog, the dog took hold of the granddaughter, the granddaughter took hold of the old woman, the old woman took hold of the old man, the old man took hold of the turnip, they pulled and pulled--and finally--out came the turnip!

example.name: taking_hold-n: physical grabbing
example.text: When appellee took hold of the short rope, he only assumed the risk incident to his taking hold of a rope of similar size and appearance.
example.arg: of a rope of similar size and appearance

roleset.name: nominal version of light verb
roleset.note: TAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia to accommodate Light verb usages in nominalized form. Corresponds to the .LV frame in verbs. Compare to 'making.02'. No VNcls. (from taking.28-n)

roles.note: This roleset should only be used for cases where 'taking' acts as a light verb and the object of 'taking' is also an eventive, predicating noun. Use argMs for all other arguments-- these cannot be predicted because they are related to the true predicate rather than 'taking'. (from taking.28-n)

role.descr: taker, subject of ligh verbish noun

example.name: taking-n: both args
example.text: There are two very amusing Grant scenes: his taking a bath in his suit and playing an orange-under-the-jaw game in a nightclub.
